metadata.title: CVE-2021-39800 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - negligible
metadata.description: In ion_ioctl of ion-ioctl.c, there is a possible way to leak kernel headdata due to a use after free. This could lead to local informationdisclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interactionis not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: AndroidkernelAndroid ID: A-208277166References: Upstream kernel

criterions.comment: linux-oem-5.13: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-oem-5.14, was not-affected').
linux-iot package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
linux-xilinx-zynqmp package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
linux-gkeop-5.15 package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
linux-ibm-5.15 package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
linux-aws-fips package in fips-updates/focal is affected and needs fixing.
linux-azure-fips package in fips-updates/focal is affected and needs fixing.
linux-gcp-fips package in fips-updates/focal is affected and needs fixing.
